physical_examinations.vital_signs: Vital signs were normal, with ventilated respirations.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patientâ€™s eyes opened to sternal rub and tracked to the right and partially to the left; the oculocephalic reflex was present. There was no spontaneous movement of the limbs. Myoclonus occurred after noxious stimuli to the legs; reflexes were brisk, and the plantar responses were flexor.

Minimal spontaneous speech and interaction, impaired comprehension, generalized hypokinesis, a spastic gait with circumduction of the right leg, absence of normal right arm swing, mild pronator drift with outstretched arms, and bilateral grasp reflexes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's speech and cognitive functions deteriorated leading up to the admission.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Opening pressure was 23 cm of water.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Testing for infectious agents was negative; other results were shown in cerebrospinal fluid analysis.
